conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, we need to analyze the given x-t graph.
The graph shows the position of the car as a function of time.
The position at t = 2 seconds is given by the point on the graph where the x-axis intersects the line representing the car's position at that time.
From the graph, the position at t = 2 seconds is approximately 10 meters.
The speed of the car is given by the slope of the line on the graph.
The slope of the line represents the change in position (x) divided by the change in time (t).
The slope of the line at t = 2 seconds is 10 meters per second (m/s).
The speed is the slope of the line at t = 2 seconds.
The speed at t = 2 seconds is 10 m/s.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 10 meters per second (m/s).
